title: Workshop on Mathematics Education Theory-Based Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics education theory and classroom observation experience
context.additional_context: A blended course research process combining theory and practice in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Learners can apply Pirie-Kieren's 'folding-back' concept to actual classroom cases for improving mathematics instruction.
Learners can develop a lesson study framework for designing mathematics concept learning pathways by leveraging principles of Variation Theory.
Learners can create a theory-based lesson observation checklist and refine it through peer feedback.

resources: Core Summary of Mathematics Education Theories
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
